00046 typedef struct _ChromosomeSegmentInformation
00047 {
00048     int count;
00049     int start;
00050     int stop;
00051     float confidence;
00052 } ChromosomeSegmentInformation;

00056 CNTrisomyEngine * CNTrisomyEngine::FromBase(BaseEngine *engine)
00057 {
00058     if (engine != NULL && engine->getEngineName() == CNTrisomyEngine::EngineName())
00059         return (CNTrisomyEngine *)engine;
00060     return NULL;
00061 }

00078 /*
00079  * Defines each of the parameters for this engine.
00080  */
00081 void CNTrisomyEngine::defineOptions()
00082 {
00083     defineOption("", "in-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00084         "Text file specifying the CN results.",
00085         "");
00086     defineOption("", "out-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00087         "Text file specifying the summary data.",
00088         "");
00089     defineOption("", "chr-numbers", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00090         "Chromosomes to report.",
00091         "");
00092     defineOption("", "chr-display", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00093         "Chromosome display names.",
00094         "");
00095     defineOption("", "syndrome-tests", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00096         "The tests for the syndromes.",
00097         "");
00098     defineOption("", "syndrome-names", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00099         "The syndrome names.",
00100         "");
00101     defineOption("", "confidence-threshold", PgOpt::DOUBLE_OPT,
00102         "The threshold for confidence values",
00103         "0.0");
00104     defineOption("", "gender-tag", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00105         "The tag in the CHP file specifying the gender call.",
00106         "Y-gender-call");
00107     defineOption("", "qc-names", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00108         "The name in the CHP file header specifying the qc metrics.",
00109         "MAPD,snp-qc");
00110     defineOption("", "qc-ops", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00111         "The operators for comparing the qc metrics.",
00112         "le,ge");
00113     defineOption("", "qc-thrs", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00114         "The thresholds for the qc metrics.",
00115         "0.27,1.1");
00116     defineOption("", "test", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00117         "Flag to run internal unit tests.",
00118         "false");
00119 }
00120 
00121 /*
00122  * Check the options to make sure that each required one is properly set.
00123  * If this engine is being run in test mode, then there are no options (other than "test")
00124  * that are required. For non-test mode, check that the required parameters, or those
00125  * that do not have a default value are set. If not then abort.
00126  */
00127 void CNTrisomyEngine::checkOptionsImp()
00128 {
00129     if (this->getOptBool("test") == false)
00130     {
00131         string str;
00132         str = getOpt("in-file");
00133         if (str.empty() == true)
00134             Err::errAbort("Must specify an input file.");
00135         str = getOpt("out-file");
00136         if (str.empty() == true)
00137             Err::errAbort("Must specify an output file.");
00138         str = getOpt("chr-display");
00139         if (str.empty() == true)
00140             Err::errAbort("Must specify chromosomes to analyze.");
00141         str = getOpt("chr-numbers");
00142         if (str.empty() == true)
00143             Err::errAbort("Must specify the display values for each chromosome.");
00144         str = getOpt("syndrome-names");
00145         if (str.empty() == true)
00146             Err::errAbort("Must specify the syndrome names.");
00147         str = getOpt("syndrome-tests");
00148         if (str.empty() == true)
00149             Err::errAbort("Must specify the tests for each syndrome.");
00150     }
00151 }

00153 /*
00154  * Convert a chromosome number represented by a string to an integer.
00155  * This assumes that X and Y are represented by a number, not character.
00156  */
00157 static u_int8_t StrToChr(const string &chr)
00158 {
00159     return (u_int8_t) atoi(chr.c_str());
00160 }
00161 
00162 /*
00163  * All up all of the markers for each of the CN states. The map passed in is a map of
00164  * CN state to a list of segment data (marker count and confidence).
00165  */
00166 static int TotalMarkers(const map<u_int8_t, list<ChromosomeSegmentInformation> > &chrStates)
00167 {
00168     int count = 0;
00169     for (map<u_int8_t, list<ChromosomeSegmentInformation> >::const_iterator it=chrStates.begin(); it!=chrStates.end(); it++)
00170     {
00171         for (list<ChromosomeSegmentInformation>::const_iterator segIt=it->second.begin(); segIt!=it->second.end(); segIt++)
00172             count += segIt->count;
00173     }
00174     return count;
00175 }
00176 
00177 /*
00178  * Write the engine options to the output file.
00179  */
00180 static void writeOptions(std::ofstream &out, Options &options)
00181 {
00182     vector<string> names;
00183     vector<PgOpt::PgOptType> types;
00184     options.getOptionNames(names);
00185     options.getOptionTypes(types);
00186     int n = (int) names.size();
00187     for (int i=0; i<n; i++)
00188     {
00189         switch (types[i])
00190         {
00191         case PgOpt::BOOL_OPT:
00192             out << "#%" << names[i] << "=" << (options.getOptBool(names[i])==true ? "true" : "false") << endl;
00193             break;
00194 
00195         case PgOpt::DOUBLE_OPT:
00196             out << "#%" << names[i] << "=" << options.getOptDouble(names[i]) << endl;
00197             break;
00198 
00199         case PgOpt::INT_OPT:
00200             out << "#%" << names[i] << "=" << options.getOptInt(names[i]) << endl;
00201             break;
00202 
00203         case PgOpt::STRING_OPT:
00204             if (options.getOpt(names[i]).empty() == false)
00205                 out << "#%" << names[i] << "=" << options.getOpt(names[i]) << endl;
00206 
00207         case PgOpt::INVALID_OPT:
00208             break;
00209 
00210         default:
00211             break;
00212         }
00213     }
00214 }

00216 /*
00217  * Write the QC metrics and the pass/fail flag of the QC to the output file.
00218  */
00219 static void writeQCMetrics(std::ofstream &out, const string &gender, const vector<string> &qcNames, const vector<float> &qcValues, bool qcTest)
00220 {
00221     out << "#%gender=" << gender << endl;
00222     for (int i=0; i<(int)qcNames.size(); i++)
00223         out << "#%" << qcNames[i] << "=" << qcValues[i] << endl;
00224     out << "#%qc-test=" << (qcTest == true ? "Pass" : "Fail") << endl;
00225 }
00226 
00227 /*
00228  * Write the summary of each reported chromosome to the output file.
00229  * The summary consists of, for each chromosome, the number of markers for a given CN state,
00230  * the fraction of markers of a CN state to the total number of markers, the confidence
00231  * of that segment. The output also includes the total marker count for the chromosome.
00232  */
00233 static void writeChromosomeSummary(std::ofstream &out, const vector<string> &chrNumbers, const vector<string> &chrDisplay,
00234                                    map<u_int8_t, map<u_int8_t, list<ChromosomeSegmentInformation> > > &chrStates)
00235 {
00236     out.setf(ios::fixed, ios::floatfield);
00237     out.precision(2);
00238     int n = (int) chrNumbers.size();
00239     for (int i=0; i<n; i++)
00240     {
00241         const string &chr = chrDisplay[i];
00242         u_int8_t chrNum = StrToChr(chrNumbers[i]);
00243         map<u_int8_t, list<ChromosomeSegmentInformation> > &states = chrStates[chrNum];
00244         int count = TotalMarkers(states);
00245         for (map<u_int8_t, list<ChromosomeSegmentInformation> >::iterator it=states.begin(); it!=states.end(); it++)
00246         {
00247             int cnCount = 0;
00248             float cnConf = 0.0f;
00249             for (list<ChromosomeSegmentInformation>::iterator segIt=it->second.begin(); segIt!=it->second.end(); segIt++)
00250             {
00251                 cnCount += segIt->count;
00252                 cnConf += segIt->confidence * segIt->count;
00253             }
00254             out << "#%chr" << chr << "-cn" << (int) it->first << "-count=" << cnCount << endl;
00255             out << "#%chr" << chr << "-cn" << (int) it->first << "-fraction=" << (float) cnCount / count << endl;
00256             out << "#%chr" << chr << "-cn" << (int) it->first << "-confidence=" << (float) cnConf / cnCount << endl;
00257         }
00258         out << "#%chr" << chr << "-count=" << count << endl;
00259     }
00260 }
00261 
00262 /*
00263  * Returns true if the chromosome is a sex chromosome.
00264  */
00265 static bool IsSexChromosome(const string &chr)
00266 {
00267     return (chr == "X" || chr == "Y");
00268 }
00269 
00270 /*
00271  * Performs a test on a value compared to a threshold.
00272  * The parameters include the operator to act on the value and its threshold.
00273  * The operators include:
00274      ge for greater than or equal to.
00275      gt for greater than.
00276      le for less than or equal to.
00277      lt for less than.
00278      eq equal to.
00279      ne not equal to.
00280 */
00281 static bool TestValue(const string &op, float value, float thr)
00282 {
00283     if (op == "ge" && value < thr)
00284     {
00285         return false;
00286     }
00287     else if (op == "gt" && value <= thr)
00288     {
00289         return false;
00290     }
00291     else if (op == "le" && value > thr)
00292     {
00293         return false;
00294     }
00295     else if (op == "lt" && value >= thr)
00296     {
00297         return false;
00298     }
00299     else if (op == "eq" && value != thr)
00300     {
00301         return false;
00302     }
00303     else if (op == "ne" && value == thr)
00304     {
00305         return false;
00306     }
00307     return true;
00308 }
00309 
00310 /*
00311  * Split the string into a vector based on the input separator.
00312  */
00313 static vector<string> split(const string &inputString, const string &sep = ",")
00314 {
00315     vector<string> tokens;
00316     size_t substrBegin = 0;
00317     for (;;)
00318     {
00319         size_t substrEnd = inputString.find (sep, substrBegin);
00320         if (substrEnd == string::npos)
00321         {
00322             // No more separators - save what's left, quit.
00323             string subString = inputString.substr (substrBegin);
00324             // Avoid returning a null string from a terminating separator or an empty inputString.
00325             if (! subString.empty())
00326                 tokens.push_back (subString);
00327             break;
00328         }
00329         // Avoid null strings from an initial separator(s).
00330         if (substrEnd != substrBegin)
00331             tokens.push_back (inputString.substr (substrBegin, substrEnd - substrBegin) );
00332         // Continue following the separator
00333         substrBegin = substrEnd + 1;
00334     }
00335     return tokens;
00336 }
00337 
00338 /*
00339  * Extract the QC metrics from the CYCHP file and compare the value to
00340  * the input thresholds.
00341  */
00342 static bool TestQcMetrics(FusionCHPMultiDataData *mchp, const vector<string> &qcNames, const vector<string> &qcThrs, const vector<string> &qcOps, vector<float> &qcValues)
00343 {
00344     bool qcTest = true;
00345     ParameterNameValueTypeList summary = mchp->GetSummaryParams();
00346     int n = (int) qcNames.size();
00347     qcValues.resize(n);
00348     for (int i=0; i<n; i++)
00349     {
00350         float thr = (float)atof(qcThrs[i].c_str());
00351         const wstring qcName = StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS(qcNames[i]);
00352         for (ParameterNameValueTypeList::iterator it=summary.begin(); it!=summary.end(); it++)
00353         {
00354             if (it->GetName() == qcName)
00355             {
00356                 qcValues[i] = it->GetValueFloat();
00357                 if (TestValue(qcOps[i], qcValues[i], thr) == false)
00358                     qcTest = false;
00359                 break;
00360             }
00361         }
00362     }
00363     return qcTest;
00364 }
00365 
00366 /*
00367  * Get the gender from the CYCHP file given a parameter name.
00368  */
00369 static affx::Gender GetGender(FusionCHPMultiDataData *mchp, const wstring &genderTag)
00370 {
00371     string female = getGenderString(affx::Female);
00372     string male = getGenderString(affx::Male);
00373     ParameterNameValueTypeList summary = mchp->GetSummaryParams();
00374     for (ParameterNameValueTypeList::iterator it=summary.begin(); it!=summary.end(); it++)
00375     {
00376         if (it->GetName() == genderTag)
00377         {
00378             if (it->GetValueAscii() == female)
00379                 return affx::Female;
00380             else if (it->GetValueAscii() == male)
00381                 return affx::Male;
00382             break;
00383         }
00384     }
00385     return affx::UnknownGender;
00386 }
00387 
00388 /*
00389  * Gather the segments (CN states and confidence values) for each input chromosome.
00390  * The CN state and confidence are stored in a structure. The structure is stored in a
00391  * map that is accessed by chromosome and CN state.
00392  */
00393 static void GatherChromosomeResults(FusionCHPMultiDataData *mchp, float confThr, const vector<string> &chrNumbers, const vector<string> &chrDisplay,
00394                                     map<u_int8_t, map<u_int8_t, list<ChromosomeSegmentInformation> > > &chrStates)
00395 {
00396     map<u_int8_t, string> chrs;
00397     for (int i=0; i<(int) chrNumbers.size(); i++)
00398         chrs[StrToChr(chrNumbers[i])] = chrDisplay[i];
00399 
00400     int n = mchp->GetEntryCount(SegmentCNMultiDataType);
00401     ChromosomeSegmentData entry;
00402     for (int i=0; i<n; i++)
00403     {
00404         mchp->GetChromosomeSegmentEntry(SegmentCNMultiDataType, i,  entry);
00405         if (chrs.find(entry.chr) == chrs.end())
00406             continue;
00407         float conf = entry.metrics[1].GetValueFloat();
00408         if (conf < confThr)
00409             continue;
00410         int cnState = (int) (entry.metrics[0].GetValueFloat() + 0.1);
00411         if (chrStates.find(entry.chr) == chrStates.end())
00412             chrStates[entry.chr] = map<u_int8_t, list<ChromosomeSegmentInformation> >();
00413         ChromosomeSegmentInformation info;
00414         info.count = entry.markerCount;
00415         info.start = entry.startPosition;
00416         info.stop = entry.stopPosition;
00417         info.confidence = conf;
00418         chrStates[entry.chr][cnState].push_back(info);
00419     }
00420 }
00421 
00422 /*
00423  * Check if the syndrome is positive given the chromosome segments summary, coverage threshold, gender, and syndrome test.
00424  * The syntax for the syndrome tests are:
00425  *   Syndrom tests separated by commas.
00426  *     Within a syndrome test you have either chromosome or gender tests.
00427  *     Chromosome tests are indicated by “chr|” and gender tests are indicated by “gender|”.
00428  *     The definition of the test is after the “|” character.
00429  *       For gender the value after the “|” character represents the gender from the CYCHP header that must be satisfied.
00430  *       There is no option for multiple values, that is it will only test for one of the valid genders: male, female, unknown.
00431  *         For example “gender|male” means the gender must be male. Pretty straight forward.
00432  *       For chromosome tests the syntax is <chr#>.<eq,lt,le,ge,lt>.<cn state>|<start>|<stop>|<coverage threshold>
00433  *     You can have multiple tests, separated by a “&” character.
00434  * For example "chr|13.eq.3|0|100000|0.7&gender|male" means chromosome 13 must have CN state equal to 3 for at least 70% and the gender must be male.
00435  */
00436 static bool SyndromeTest(const vector<string> &chrNumbers, map<u_int8_t, map<u_int8_t, list<ChromosomeSegmentInformation> > > &chrStates, affx::Gender gender, const string &syndromeTest, float &coverage)
00437 {
00438     coverage = 0.0f;
00439     vector<string> tests = split(syndromeTest, "&");
00440     string genderString = getGenderString(gender);
00441     for (vector<string>::iterator testsIt=tests.begin(); testsIt!=tests.end(); testsIt++)
00442     {
00443         vector<string> test = split(*testsIt, "|");
00444         if (test[0] == "gender")
00445         {
00446             if (test[1] != genderString)
00447                 return false;
00448         }
00449         else if (test[0] == "chr")
00450         {
00451             vector<string> chrTest = split(test[1], ".");
00452             int start = atoi(test[2].c_str());
00453             int stop = atoi(test[3].c_str());
00454             float covThr = (float)atof(test[4].c_str());
00455             u_int8_t chr = StrToChr(chrTest[0]);
00456             string op = chrTest[1];
00457             u_int8_t cn = StrToChr(chrTest[2]);
00458             if (chrStates.find(chr) == chrStates.end())
00459                 return false;
00460             int total = 0;
00461             int count = 0;
00462             for (map<u_int8_t, list<ChromosomeSegmentInformation> >::iterator cnIt=chrStates[chr].begin(); cnIt!=chrStates[chr].end(); cnIt++)
00463             {
00464                 for (list<ChromosomeSegmentInformation>::iterator segIt=cnIt->second.begin(); segIt!=cnIt->second.end(); segIt++)
00465                 {
00466                     int overlap = min(stop, segIt->stop) - max(start, segIt->start);
00467                     if (overlap > 0)
00468                     {
00469                         total += overlap;
00470                         if ((op == "eq" && cnIt->first == cn) ||
00471                             (op == "lt" && cnIt->first < cn) ||
00472                             (op == "le" && cnIt->first <= cn) ||
00473                             (op == "gt" && cnIt->first > cn) ||
00474                             (op == "ge" && cnIt->first >= cn))
00475                         {
00476                             count += overlap;
00477                         }
00478                     }
00479                 }
00480             }
00481             coverage = (float) count / total;
00482             if (coverage < covThr)
00483                 return false;
00484         }
00485     }
00486     return true;
00487 }
00488 
00489 /*
00490  * Perform unit tests of the static functions.
00491  */
00492 static void UnitTests()
00493 {
00494     if (StrToChr("1") != 1)
00495         Err::errAbort("failed StrToChr1");
00496     if (StrToChr("24") != 24)
00497         Err::errAbort("failed StrToChr2");
00498 
00499     ChromosomeSegmentInformation seg={0,0,0,0.0};
00500 
00501     map<u_int8_t, list<ChromosomeSegmentInformation> > states;
00502     seg.count = 2;
00503     states[0].push_back(seg);
00504     seg.count = 3;
00505     states[1].push_back(seg);
00506     if (TotalMarkers(states) != 5)
00507         Err::errAbort("failed TotalMarkers1");
00508     states.clear();
00509     if (TotalMarkers(states) != 0)
00510         Err::errAbort("failed TotalMarkers2");
00511 
00512     if (IsSexChromosome("1") == true)
00513         Err::errAbort("failed IsSexChromosome1");
00514     if (IsSexChromosome("2") == true)
00515         Err::errAbort("failed IsSexChromosome2");
00516     if (IsSexChromosome("X") == false)
00517         Err::errAbort("failed IsSexChromosome3");
00518     if (IsSexChromosome("Y") == false)
00519         Err::errAbort("failed IsSexChromosome4");
00520 
00521     if (TestValue("eq", 1.0, 1.0) == false)
00522         Err::errAbort("failed TestValue1");
00523     if (TestValue("eq", 1.0, 2.0) == true)
00524         Err::errAbort("failed TestValue2");
00525     if (TestValue("ne", 1.0, 1.0) == true)
00526         Err::errAbort("failed TestValue3");
00527     if (TestValue("ne", 1.0, 2.0) == false)
00528         Err::errAbort("failed TestValue4");
00529     if (TestValue("lt", 1.0, 2.0) == false)
00530         Err::errAbort("failed TestValue5");
00531     if (TestValue("lt", 3.0, 1.0) == true)
00532         Err::errAbort("failed TestValue6");
00533     if (TestValue("le", 1.0, 1.0) == false)
00534         Err::errAbort("failed TestValue7");
00535     if (TestValue("le", 1.0, 2.0) == false)
00536         Err::errAbort("failed TestValue8");
00537     if (TestValue("le", 2.0, 1.0) == true)
00538         Err::errAbort("failed TestValue9");
00539 
00540     if (TestValue("gt", 1.0, 2.0) == true)
00541         Err::errAbort("failed TestValue10");
00542     if (TestValue("gt", 3.0, 1.0) == false)
00543         Err::errAbort("failed TestValue11");
00544     if (TestValue("ge", 1.0, 1.0) == false)
00545         Err::errAbort("failed TestValue12");
00546     if (TestValue("ge", 1.0, 2.0) == true)
00547         Err::errAbort("failed TestValue13");
00548     if (TestValue("ge", 2.0, 1.0) == false)
00549         Err::errAbort("failed TestValue14");
00550 
00551     float coverage;
00552     vector<string> chrNumbers;
00553     ChromosomeSegmentInformation info = {0, 0, 0, 0.0};
00554 
00555     map<u_int8_t, map<u_int8_t, list<ChromosomeSegmentInformation> > > chrStates;
00556     affx::Gender gender = affx::Male;
00557     chrNumbers.push_back("1");
00558     if (SyndromeTest(chrNumbers, chrStates, gender, "chr|24.eq.1|0|10000000000000|0.70&chr|25.eq.0|0|10000000000000|0.70&gender|female", coverage) == true)
00559         Err::errAbort("failed SyndromeTest1");
00560     info.count = 100;
00561     info.start = 0;
00562     info.stop = 1000;
00563     chrStates[1][3].push_back(info);
00564     if (SyndromeTest(chrNumbers, chrStates, gender, "chr|1.eq.3|0|10000000000000|0.70&gender|male", coverage) == false)
00565         Err::errAbort("failed SyndromeTest2");
00566     info.start = 1000;
00567     chrStates[1][2].push_back(info);
00568     if (SyndromeTest(chrNumbers, chrStates, gender, "chr|1.eq.3|0|10000000000000|0.70&gender|male", coverage) == true)
00569         Err::errAbort("failed SyndromeTest3");
00570     info.count = 100000;
00571     chrStates[1][4].push_back(info);
00572     if (SyndromeTest(chrNumbers, chrStates, gender, "chr|1.ge.3|0|10000000000000|0.70&gender|male", coverage) == false)
00573         Err::errAbort("failed SyndromeTest4");
00574     if (SyndromeTest(chrNumbers, chrStates, gender, "chr|1.gt.3|0|10000000000000|0.70&gender|male", coverage) == false)
00575         Err::errAbort("failed SyndromeTest5");
00576     if (SyndromeTest(chrNumbers, chrStates, gender, "chr|1.le.4|0|10000000000000|0.70&gender|male", coverage) == false)
00577         Err::errAbort("failed SyndromeTest6");
00578     if (SyndromeTest(chrNumbers, chrStates, gender, "chr|1.le.2|0|10000000000000|0.70&gender|male", coverage) == true)
00579         Err::errAbort("failed SyndromeTest7");
00580 }
00581 
00582 /*
00583  * Run the analsis.
00584  * If the analysis parameters specify unit testing then only run the unit tests.
00585  * The non-unit test analysis is performed by:
00586  *   Read the input CYCHP file.
00587  *     Extract the QC metrics and perform the QC test.
00588  *     Extract the segment information in a map accessed by chromosome and CN state.
00589  *     Get the calculated gender.
00590  *   Create the output file and output the header.
00591  *   Test each syndrome and output its status.
00592  */
00593 void CNTrisomyEngine::runImp()
00594 {
00595     checkOptions();
00596 
00597     // Run the internal tests
00598     if (getOptBool("test") == true)
00599     {
00600         UnitTests();
00601         return;
00602     }
00603 
00604     // Read the CHP file.
00605     string inFile = getOpt("in-file");
00606     FusionCHPData *chp = FusionCHPDataReg::Read(inFile);
00607     if (chp == NULL)
00608         Err::errAbort("Unable to read the CYCHP file.");
00609     FusionCHPMultiDataData *mchp = FusionCHPMultiDataData::FromBase(chp);
00610 
00611     // Get the QC metrics and apply the thresholds to determine pass/fail
00612     vector<float> qcValues;
00613     vector<string> qcNames = split(getOpt("qc-names"));
00614     vector<string> qcThrs = split(getOpt("qc-thrs"));
00615     vector<string> qcOps = split(getOpt("qc-ops"));
00616     bool qcTest = TestQcMetrics(mchp, qcNames, qcThrs, qcOps, qcValues);
00617 
00618     // Gather the CN states.
00619     map<u_int8_t, map<u_int8_t, list<ChromosomeSegmentInformation> > > chrStates;
00620     double confThr = getOptDouble("confidence-threshold");
00621     vector<string> chrNumbers = split(getOpt("chr-numbers"));
00622     vector<string> chrDisplay = split(getOpt("chr-display"));
00623     GatherChromosomeResults(mchp, confThr, chrNumbers, chrDisplay, chrStates);
00624 
00625     // Get the gender
00626     wstring genderTag = StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS(getOpt("gender-tag"));
00627     affx::Gender gender = GetGender(mchp, genderTag);
00628 
00629     // Close the CHP file.
00630     delete mchp;
00631     mchp = NULL;
00632 
00633     // Create the output file.
00634     string outFile = getOpt("out-file");
00635     ofstream out(outFile.c_str(), ios::out);
00636 
00637     // Output the header.
00638     writeOptions(out, *this);
00639     writeQCMetrics(out, getGenderString(gender), qcNames, qcValues, qcTest);
00640     writeChromosomeSummary(out, chrNumbers, chrDisplay, chrStates);
00641 
00642     // Test each syndrome.
00643     vector<string> syndromeNames = split(getOpt("syndrome-names"));
00644     vector<string> syndromeTests = split(getOpt("syndrome-tests"));
00645     int n = (int) syndromeNames.size();
00646     float coverage = 0.0f;
00647     out << "Syndrome" << "\t" << "Status" << "\t" << "Coverage" << endl;
00648     for (int i=0; i<n; i++)
00649     {
00650         bool status = SyndromeTest(chrNumbers, chrStates, gender, syndromeTests[i], coverage);
00651         out << syndromeNames[i] << "\t";
00652         if (status == true)
00653             out << "Positive" << "\t" << coverage << endl;
00654         else
00655             out << "Negative" << "\t" << endl;
00656     }
00657     out.close();
00658 }
